meanings.definition: The quality of being logical and consistent.
meanings.sent1: Her essay lacked coherence, jumping from one idea to another without a clear connection.
meanings.sent2: The coherence of his argument made it easy to follow his line of thinking.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit relied on the coherence of the actors' lines to deliver the punchline.
meanings.sent4: The team's coherence on the field was like a well-oiled machine, each player knowing their role perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The coherence of the puzzle pieces made it satisfying to see the complete picture.

meanings.definition: The state of forming a unified whole.
meanings.sent1: The coherence of the design elements in the room created a harmonious atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The coherence of the story's plot tied all the loose ends together seamlessly.
meanings.sent3: The art exhibit aimed to disrupt the coherence of traditional paintings with abstract forms.
meanings.sent4: The orchestra's coherence during the performance was like a symphony of unity and precision.
meanings.sent5: The coherence of the flavors in the dish blended perfectly, creating a delightful taste experience.

meanings.definition: The ability to communicate clearly and effectively.
meanings.sent1: His lack of coherence in explaining the project confused the team members.
meanings.sent2: The coherence of her speech captivated the audience, making her message impactful.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's intentional lack of coherence in his jokes left the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The coherence of the marketing campaign resonated with customers, leading to increased sales.
meanings.sent5: The coherence of the instructions made it easy for everyone to understand the task at hand.
